MaCh3PythonUtils.diagnostics.mcmc_plots.diagnostics.covariance_matrix_utils module

Additional Diagnostics that can be used with MCMC but don’t rely on plotting

Suboptimality : https://www.jstor.org/stable/25651249?seq=3

class MaCh3PythonUtils.diagnostics.mcmc_plots.diagnostics.covariance_matrix_utils.CovarianceMatrixUtils(chain_handler: ChainHandler)[source]

Bases: object

calculate_covariance_matrix(min_step: int = 0, max_step: int = -1) → ndarray[source]

_summary_

Parameters:

  • min_step (int, optional) – Steps at which to calculate covariance matrix at, defaults to 0

  • max_step (int, optional) – Maximum step to calculate covariance matrix at, defaults to -1 indicating you want to evaluate the full chain

Returns:

Covariance matrix at each Nth step

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_suboptimality(step_skip: int = 1000, min_step=0) → None[source]

Calculates the suboptimality for every step_skip steps

Parameters:

  • step_skip (int, optional) – Number of steps to skip, defaults to 1000

  • min_step (int, optional) – smallest number of starting steps, defaults to 0

plot_suboptimality(output_file: str)[source]

Plots suboptimality value

Parameters:

output_file (str) – Output PDF file
